channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Heard on the Street: The smooth acceleration shown by Tesla in the past two years faltered in the second quarter, and CEO Elon Musk has offered hints that the problems run deeper than lockdowns in Shanghai https://t.co/gjs00QM3Gg
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/tpYrmuPnkM
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/kirqTrzzvK

Jeff Bezos criticized President Biden for pressing gas station companies to immediately lower prices at the pump, accusing the president of “misdirection” or “a deep misunderstanding” of market forces that have driven up costs https://t.co/mRLrbZJN4l
It has been three weeks since crypto lender Celsius Network took the drastic step of halting customers’ withdrawals https://t.co/YzBFUXkRZW
From @WSJopinion: The Jan. 6 committee is steeped in partisanship. But Republicans can’t afford to look away from the accumulating evidence of Trump's conduct. https://t.co/Ugz68ke1ZH
With Russia able to control Ukraine’s grain exports, Moscow has found a new way to wield influence around the world https://t.co/nNmZSfLhyS

Russian forces captured Lysychansk, the last major Ukrainian stronghold in Luhansk, effectively placing under Russian control the eastern region at the epicenter of the war in recent months https://t.co/Kqad2mp7Zt
“My dogs are my life,” says footwear designer Manolo Blahnik, who has nine of them, including six puppies. https://t.co/ZuVO7QXyXL

Obituary: Leonardo Del Vecchio grew up in an Italian orphanage and went to work as a metal-molding apprentice at age 14. When he set up his own shop, he quickly realized that making eyeglass frames was the most profitable part of his business. https://t.co/pv0Ly12swE
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/FL4nWSNeVp
Authorities in Hong Kong are searching for more than two dozen seamen in the South China Sea after a ship broke in half during a typhoon https://t.co/yKjWZ36Ddi

Russia is waging two wars right now: a hot war with Ukraine whose costs are measured in death and destruction, and a cold war with the West whose costs are measured in economic hardship and inflation. https://t.co/rs3odW6zRg

A surprising finding suggests that polar bears, which typically depend on sea ice for hunting seals, may prove resilient in the face of the continuing loss of sea ice as the climate warms https://t.co/4SD62WzKix
Companies are going all in on advertising their morning-after pills, diverting marketing budgets to spotlight legal emergency contraception https://t.co/c56jN9EhMT

Cassidy Hutchinson has faced a wave of online attacks from Trump’s supporters following her testimony before the Jan. 6 committee, and is said to have security for her own protection, people close to her said: “She is waking up to a different life." https://t.co/QDDt0GtS0M

Since Beijing imposed a national security law on Hong Kong, jailed pro-democracy leaders have spent months without trial and fear they’ll spend the rest of their lives behind bars https://t.co/mM2UjdM74M

From @WSJopinion: The fury of the left’s reaction isn’t merely about guns and abortion. It reflects their grief at having lost the Court as the vehicle for achieving policy goals they can’t get through legislatures. https://t.co/Cd5bYMbtle

From @WSJopinion: The GOP has a golden opportunity to become the party for parents, but it won’t be able to hold on to that title by simply saying so. It will need to prove it, writes @DeAngelisCorey. https://t.co/SPG3dF9EO1
The Vatican sold a London commercial building at the center of one of the biggest scandals of Pope Francis’ reign, at a loss of some $140 million https://t.co/dAjZW43vOb
From @WSJopinion: Cassidy Hutchinson showed more guts than any of Trump’s men. Her testimony strengthens the case for prosecution, writes @Peggynoonannyc. https://t.co/QLvKJlaZJj
Liz Cheney’s criticism of Donald Trump has alienated many Republicans in Wyoming, opening the door for challenger Harriet Hageman https://t.co/hAZYKUhVhu
A 71-year-old Pennsylvania woman was attacked by a bison in Yellowstone National Park, the third goring in the park in recent weeks https://t.co/FepnBKEEWZ
The U.S. plans to block new offshore oil drilling in the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, but allow limited expansion in the Gulf of Mexico and off Alaska https://t.co/NzPeqNWJSO
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/9krqISUIFW

President Biden selected more than a dozen people to receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the country’s highest civilian honor, including Simone Biles, Steve Jobs, Denzel Washington and John McCain https://t.co/fFXbSvAN1x
An 8-year-old boy, James, was reunited with his family after losing them in the chaos of the Kabul airport last year when the Taliban was taking power in Afghanistan https://t.co/cBWcaWQCl4
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/OP2DwR9Vh0

From @WSJopinion: We didn’t often agree with Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer, but tip a cap to his honorable 58-year career that included stints in all three branches of government https://t.co/m5mxWklsIx
Apple released the first-ever iPhone in the U.S. on June 29, 2007. Here’s a look back at every iteration. https://t.co/iIeLE1KuRN
Jerry Hall filed for divorce from Rupert Murdoch, citing “irreconcilable differences” and seeking spousal support https://t.co/DDaK5Gj6OZ
New York lawmakers overhauled the state’s gun laws and started the process of amending the state Constitution to cement the right to an abortion. https://t.co/SI3YoXGuCc
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/SnarZ8Hzyi
Google said it would begin automatically deleting visits to abortion clinics from its users’ location history, a move that follows last week’s Supreme Court decision https://t.co/GDpBIztY0R

Every July 1, former Major League slugger Bobby Bonilla gets $1.2 million from the New York Mets, a team he hasn’t played for in over 20 years. It's either one of the worst deals in sports history or the most brilliant retirement plan by an athlete ever. https://t.co/RuUywMUSZ8

President Biden selected more than a dozen people to receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the country’s highest civilian honor, including Simone Biles, Steve Jobs, Denzel Washington and John McCain https://t.co/33LHbF8F08
Inflation-protected U.S. savings bonds are yielding an eye-popping 9.62%—if you can fight through the red tape to actually buy one https://t.co/05yNwzyWMu
Ukrainian officers say recently supplied U.S. guided-rocket systems are strengthening their hand against Russian forces https://t.co/qWKeE5BRt8
Apple released the first-ever iPhone in the U.S. on June 29, 2007. Here’s a look back at every iteration. https://t.co/ApIj80xVLM
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/eesj7KWjY8
From @WSJopinion: Cassidy Hutchinson showed more guts than any of Trump’s men. Her testimony strengthens the case for prosecution, writes @Peggynoonannyc. https://t.co/YReDiztMoq
WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has appealed his extradition from the U.K., prolonging legal wrangling over whether he should be sent to the U.S. to face spying charges https://t.co/oqWEIu4fZq

A former top corporate lawyer for Apple pleaded guilty to insider trading, admitting he used access to the company’s undisclosed earnings results to reap hundreds of thousands of dollars in illicit gains, prosecutors said https://t.co/oNvnb1jVcs
After nine days, Elon Musk is on his longest stretch without posting on Twitter in nearly five years https://t.co/JCgdUbUsCn
New Zealand designated far-right group the Proud Boys as a terrorist organization, highlighting the role that the group played in last year’s attack on the U.S. Capitol https://t.co/eRX7xGxTNJ

President Biden said he supports changing Senate filibuster rules, which would allow legislation protecting abortion access to pass the chamber with 51 votes rather than 60. Here's what you need to know. https://t.co/ZcIadxKhjG
Air New Zealand plans to introduce pods with flat beds in economy class, initially installing them on direct flights to Chicago and New York from Auckland https://t.co/K7Ow8oxaF0
SpaceX has been given permission to operate its satellite-internet service Starlink on everything from airplanes and boats to RVs https://t.co/1Q3QxF4ZPo
After nine days, Elon Musk is on his longest stretch without posting on Twitter in nearly five years https://t.co/GnTA2N9Xcc
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/u2gYtg6jCK
